evidence: Clear separation of concerns with 'database', 'plugins', and utility modules
Plugins are organized by feature/functionality (e.g., banned, broadcast, channel)
Shared utilities and common components reused across modules
No evidence of distributed services or APIs suggesting microservices
Single deployment unit indicated by presence of Dockerfile, requirements.txt, and start.sh
Database access is centralized but not abstracted behind a port/adapter pattern
risks: Tight coupling possible through direct imports between modules
Lack of explicit interface contracts may lead to maintenance challenges
Absence of package structure might limit scalability in larger projects
